{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3332670,"name":"Paul Rensing","username":"prensing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prensing/{size}/65820_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T03:12:06.255Z","cooked":"

We are trying to get a Rev Through Bore encoder reading directly into a SparkMax , in absolute mode, and we are having no luck. We bought the REV-11-1881 Alternate Encoder Adapter. Unfortunately, maybe we need the REV-11-3326? But the web pages say it should work, and we are getting nothing.

Here is a picture of the wiring.

PXL_20240314_0051452901920×2560 407 KB

I tried lots of variations on the software and nothing read out. I just looked at the MAXSwerve template. I think I tried those calls, but can’t be certain. Also, we tried the different switch positions on the 1881 board, but it did not help.

Any suggestions? Should the 1881 board work, or is it very different from 3326? If so, can it be made to work?

Yeah, the pinout is incorrect with that board. Here’s a post on how you can modify it to work:

Absolute encoder adapter or alternate encoder adapter Electrical
Ran into the same issue. After a bit of reverse engineering, came up with this quick rework that turns and Alternate Encoder Adapter into an Absolute Encoder Adapter. The through bore encoder gets power/gnd through the red and black wires, and all that’s left to do is to pass the “absolute” signal in the white wire to pin 6 on the data port. The rest of the wires don’t do anything. [adapter-rework] On the Alternate Encoder Adapter, the signal from the blue wire is passed through to pin 6, so …

I have no idea why REV doesn’t put this info on their product page or in the documentation:

REV Robotics - 2022/23 Product Releases & Updates General Forum
Hopefully I can clear up some of the confusion. There are three adapter boards that will provide the best ways to connect external sensors to the SPARK MAX. The first one is used as a generic breakout for the Data Port: SPARK MAX Data Port Breakout You can think of the other two as adapters specifically designed for the REV Through Bore Encoder. Alternate Encoder Adapter Absolute Encoder Adapter (launching soon) Depending on which motor type you are driving and which sensor type you want…
